comment.author: 10730964@N04
comment._content: Early African Americans made a banjo, which was built from a gourd. “It is clear that the banjo as it was first known in America was an African instrument. It remained a black instrument until the 1840’s when minstrel shows took it on as part of their black face farces. Only then did the banjo become a badge of ridicule for Afro-Americans; they generally gave it up, allowing white southerners to claim it as their own invention.” -For an in depth discussion I highly recommend John Michael Vlach’s book, The Afro-American Tradition in Decorative Arts, University of Georgia Press. charlottehutson.wordpress.com/2009/04/30/musical-roots/
